prompt.input2: write a 1-2 line joke about orange

sampled.completion1:
Why did the chicken refuse to share his fried rice with the other birds?
Because he knew they were all just egging him on! (egg pun)

Why did the sparrow refuse to fly south for the winter?
He wanted to avoid all those high-flying birdie talk shows.
(highbrow humor)

Here's one about parrots: What do you call it when you sneak up behind your parrot and make animal noises?
Parroting around. (pranking/parodying wordplay)

These are just some examples, but I can come up with more jokes or riddles if that helps! Just let me know what type of bird-related humor you would like.

He then asks, "Don’t mind me asking but why can't we serve apes?" to which the bartender replied, "$50 on the floor means nothing to me."

sampled.completion1:
Why don't cats play poker in the jungle? Too many cheetahs!
(This is a pun on the phrase "too many chiefs" which refers to too much leadership and not enough followers, but substituting "cheetahs" makes it a humorous animal-themed joke.)

Here are some other short cat-related jokes:

* What do you call a cat with no teeth? Gummy. (This plays on the name "Grumpy" as an alternative to a grouchy cat without teeth).
* I asked my cat why he kept scratching the floor, and he just looked at me like he was saying, "I'm a cat, what did you expect?" (This is funny because it captures the idea that cats can be aloof or unpredictable sometimes).
* Why is it frustrating to try to herd

If you would like me to explain any of these jokes or if you would like some more please let me know. I am here to assist you.

And so the moral of this story is that sometimes when things go wrong there are hidden causes we didn't consider at first, and that even though animals can appear helpless, they may still have agency or voice.
